info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 8:13AM CDT until April 1 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Yellow River at Babcock affecting Wood County.
For the Yellow River...including Pittsville, Babcock...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Yellow River at Babcock.
* WHEN...From this morning to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding is confined mainly to agricultural...wooded lowland and marshes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Monday was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest today just above flood stage this morning or afternoon, then fall below flood stage late this evening to 6.8 feet early Thursday morning. It will then rise to 8.9 feet early Saturday afternoon into Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening by 1115 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON
